name: TheAtlantic
text: Conspiracy theories seem to be everywhere, @AdrienneLaF reports. Why are we living in such a mass rejection of reas… https://t.co/yLAznruhGr

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Video technology is a substitute, but I think it's a poor substitute, and the bulk of business travel will come back. But it's going to take some time." — Ed Bastian, CEO of Delta Airlines at #TheAtlanticFest 2020 https://t.co/t4s0uYxMYz https://t.co/mnOXywATAv

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We've had up to 40,000 of our employees...take months of unpaid leave at a time, so we've been able to offset almost 50 percent of all of our costs by those employees during these last six months." — Ed Bastian, CEO of Delta Airlines #TheAtlanticFest https://t.co/t4s0uYxMYz https://t.co/LpyKrk5lIP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @beccarosen: Absolutely incisive piece by @ARozenshtein about the era that has now ended—and the new one that has just begun: https://t.co/Ol68yAUWOG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: NEW The debate is a week from tonight. How much of a guide will Biden’s primary debate performances be for what will happen when he walks out on stage with a man he clearly despises?

Other than at Trump’s inauguration, they’ve never met in person before.
https://t.co/0WwpVBhMNP

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In time, liberals may yet win the battle over the federal courts, but any victory will be bittersweet, because in their hearts they will know that the lofty dream is dead," @ARozenshtein writes: https://t.co/qfPpPstQTw

name: TheAtlantic
text: The United States spends more on health care than any other developed country. What would it take to reduce the country’s health-care costs without sacrificing the quality of care? Join us now for day two of #TheAtlanticFest 2020. https://t.co/AP5KOo8MZz

name: TheAtlantic
text: Instead of individual episodes that impinge upon us, like bombs lobbed by an angry god, disasters are now an ongoing and possibly permanent texture to our lives, writes @Emma_Marris. And we cannot forget—these are disasters. https://t.co/UtvXftduYL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Related: One disaster is bad. Two are exponentially worse, @jdkstern13 wrote in August. https://t.co/vCNRlIC8br

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "The entire country is literally a disaster area." https://t.co/0xFHou2Xlz

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @ibogost: People tend to think that friendships are most real when carried out in person. But the pandemic forced us to put our friends at a distance. @evahagberg asks: What if this new architecture of friendship is a good thing, actually?

https://t.co/da1yyAwv2H
